elements.title: Kwan Man-ching
elements.contents: ... that Kwan Man-ching (pictured), who directed more than fifty films in forty years, entered the industry hoping to meet his celebrity crush?

elements.title: Gruppentheorie und Quantenmechanik
elements.contents: ... that the style of Hermann Weyl's Gruppentheorie und Quantenmechanik has been likened to "a smiling figure on horseback, cutting a clean way through ... with a swift bright sword"?

elements.title: Naz Arıcı
elements.contents: ... that international adult figure skating champion Naz Arıcı learned to skate at the age of 29?

elements.title: the same thirteen-year-old conjecture
elements.contents: ... that in 1967 two mathematicians published PhD dissertations independently disproving the same thirteen-year-old conjecture?

elements.title: Shalom Nagar
elements.contents: ... that Shalom Nagar, executioner of war criminal and Nazi Party official Adolf Eichmann, said he was selected at random for the role?

elements.title: artificial intelligence rhetoric
elements.contents: ... that Kevin Roose wrote a viral article about artificial intelligence rhetoric after an AI bot attempted to convince him to leave his wife?

elements.title: Karl Thielscher
elements.contents: ... that Karl Thielscher began refereeing American football games less than a month after retiring from playing the sport professionally?

elements.title: Petergofsky District
elements.contents: ... that between February and August 1918 the Petergofsky District mobilized more than 20 combat units for the Red Army?

elements.title: his amusement park
elements.contents: ... that a South Korean actor sold his belongings and went $7 million into debt to keep his amusement park running?
